instanceMethods.name: setAttribute
instanceMethods.summary:
Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing
attribute. `id` is reserved and an exception is thrown if you try to set
it. Non string values (such as {Date}s) will be converted to appropriate
string format so that they can be read back using {::getAttribute()}.
Setting an attribute to `null` or `undefined` will remove the attribute.
instanceMethods.description:

attribute. `id` is reserved and an exception is thrown if you try to set
it. Non string values (such as {Date}s) will be converted to appropriate
string format so that they can be read back using {::getAttribute()}.
Setting an attribute to `null` or `undefined` will remove the attribute.

instanceMethods.summary:
Removes an attribute from the specified item. Attempting to remove
an attribute that is not on the item doesn't raise an exception.

an attribute that is not on the item doesn't raise an exception.

Item.summary: A paragraph of text in an {Outline}.
Item.description:
A paragraph of text in an {Outline}.

Items cannot be instantiated directly, instead use {Outline::createItem}.

Items may contain other child items to form a hierarchical outline structure.
When you move an item all of its children are moved with it.

Items have a single paragraph of body text. You can access it as plain text,
a HTML string, or an AttributedString. You can add formatting to make parts
of the text bold, italic, etc.

You can assign item level attributes to items. For example you might store a
due date in the `data-due-date` attribute. Or store an item type in the
`data-type` attribute.

examples.code:
effectiveRange = end: 0
textLength = item.bodyText.length
while effectiveRange.end < textLength
  console.log item.getElementsAtBodyTextIndex effectiveRange.end, effectiveRange
examples.raw:
```coffeescript
effectiveRange = end: 0
textLength = item.bodyText.length
while effectiveRange.end < textLength
  console.log item.getElementsAtBodyTextIndex effectiveRange.end, effectiveRange
```

Mutation.summary: A record of a single change in a target {Item}.
Mutation.description:
A record of a single change in a target {Item}.

A new mutation is created to record each attribute set, body text change,
and child item's update. Use {Outline::onDidChange} to receive this mutation
record so you can track what has changed as an outline is edited.

Invoke the given callback synchronously _before_ the outline

Outline.description:
A mutable outline of {Item}s.

Use outlines to create new items, find existing items, and watch for changes
in items. Outlines also coordinate loading and saving items.

Internally a {HTMLDocument} is used to store the underlying outline data.
You should never modify the content of this HTMLDocument directly, but you
can query it using {::evaluateXPath}. The structure of this document is
described in [FoldingText Markup Language](README#ft-markup-language).

examples.code:
outline.beginUpdates()
root = outline.root
root.appendChild outline.createItem()
root.appendChild outline.createItem()
root.firstChild.bodyText = 'first'
root.lastChild.bodyText = 'last'
outline.endUpdates()
examples.raw:
```coffeescript
outline.beginUpdates()
root = outline.root
root.appendChild outline.createItem()
root.appendChild outline.createItem()
root.firstChild.bodyText = 'first'
root.lastChild.bodyText = 'last'
outline.endUpdates()
```

examples.code:
disposable = outline.onDidChange (mutations) ->
  for mutation in mutations
    switch mutation.type
      when Mutation.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.attributeName
      when Mutation.BODT_TEXT_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.target.bodyText
      when Mutation.CHILDREN_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.addedItems
        console.log mutation.removedItems
examples.raw:
```coffeescript
disposable = outline.onDidChange (mutations) ->
  for mutation in mutations
    switch mutation.type
      when Mutation.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.attributeName
      when Mutation.BODT_TEXT_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.target.bodyText
      when Mutation.CHILDREN_CHANGED
        console.log mutation.addedItems
        console.log mutation.removedItems
```

examples.description: Use XPath to list all items with bold text:
examples.code:
for each in outline.getItemsForXPath('//b')
  console.log each
examples.raw:
```coffeescript
for each in outline.getItemsForXPath('//b')
  console.log each
```

Given a view DOM element find and return the {OutlineEditor} that
contains it. For example this is useful when doing event handling. If you
detect a click on some element you use this method to find the associated
editor.

instanceMethods.name: addSearchAttributeShortcut
instanceMethods.summary:
Add a shortcut for an attribute name in the
{OutlineEditor.ITEM_PATH_SEARCH} search syntax. For example if you want
the user to be able to type `@status` instead of having to type `@data-
status` then you can add `status` as a shortcut for `data-status`.
instanceMethods.description:
Add a shortcut for an attribute name in the
{OutlineEditor.ITEM_PATH_SEARCH} search syntax. For example if you want
the user to be able to type `@status` instead of having to type `@data-
status` then you can add `status` as a shortcut for `data-status`.

arguments.name: error
arguments.description: Any error encountered while parsing search query.

returnValues.description: Returns search {Object} with keys:

instanceMethods.name: setSearch
instanceMethods.summary:
Sets search used to filter the contents of this outline. The
search `type` parameter determines how the search is performed. It
defaults to {OutlineEditor.ITEM_PATH_SEARCH} syntax, but you can also use
{OutlineEditor.X_PATH_SEARCH} syntax.
instanceMethods.description:
Sets search used to filter the contents of this outline. The
search `type` parameter determines how the search is performed. It
defaults to {OutlineEditor.ITEM_PATH_SEARCH} syntax, but you can also use
{OutlineEditor.X_PATH_SEARCH} syntax.

instanceMethods.name: addItemBodyTextRenderer
instanceMethods.summary:
Render additional text formatting elements in an {Item}'s body
text. Intended to support syntax highlighting.
instanceMethods.description:
Render additional text formatting elements in an {Item}'s body
text. Intended to support syntax highlighting.

children.name: renderElementInBodyTextRange
children.description: {Function} Render text element, accepts the same parameters as {Item::addElementInBodyTextRange}.

examples.code:
editor.addItemBodyTextRenderer (item, renderElementInBodyTextRange) ->
  highlight = 'super!'
  while (index = item.bodyText.indexOf highlight, index) isnt -1
    renderElementInBodyTextRange 'B', null, index, highlight.length
    index += highlight.length
examples.raw:
```coffee
editor.addItemBodyTextRenderer (item, renderElementInBodyTextRange) ->
  highlight = 'super!'
  while (index = item.bodyText.indexOf highlight, index) isnt -1
    renderElementInBodyTextRange 'B', null, index, highlight.length
    index += highlight.length
```

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to remove the renderer.

instanceMethods.name: addItemBadgeRenderer
instanceMethods.summary:
Render item badges after an {Item}'s body text. Item badges are
intended to make visible item attribute values. For example badges are
used to display the `data-priority` attribute of an item.
instanceMethods.description:
Render item badges after an {Item}'s body text. Item badges are
intended to make visible item attribute values. For example badges are
used to display the `data-priority` attribute of an item.

examples.code:
editor.addItemBadgeRenderer (item, renderBadgeElement) ->
  if tags = item.getAttribute 'data-tags', true
    for each in tags
      span = document.createElement 'A'
      span.className = 'btag'
      span.textContent = each.trim()
      renderBadgeElement span
examples.raw:
```coffee
editor.addItemBadgeRenderer (item, renderBadgeElement) ->
  if tags = item.getAttribute 'data-tags', true
    for each in tags
      span = document.createElement 'A'
      span.className = 'btag'
      span.textContent = each.trim()
      renderBadgeElement span
```

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to remove the renderer.

instanceMethods.name: isVisible
instanceMethods.summary:
Determine if an {Item} is visible. An item is visible if it
descends from the current hoisted item, and it isn't filtered, and all
ancestors up to hoisted node are expanded.
instanceMethods.description:
Determine if an {Item} is visible. An item is visible if it
descends from the current hoisted item, and it isn't filtered, and all
ancestors up to hoisted node are expanded.

returnValues.description: Returns {Boolean} indicating if item is visible.

instanceMethods.name: makeVisible
instanceMethods.summary:
Make the given item visible in the outline, expanding ancestors,
removing filter, and unhoisting as needed.

Returns previous visible {Item} relative to given item.

Returns previous visible branch {Item} relative to given item.

returnValues.description: Returns {Boolean} indicating if given item is selected.
Returns `true` if is selecting at item level.
Returns `true` if is selecting at text level.

OutlineEditor.description:
Editor for {Outline}s.

Maintains all editing state for the outline incuding: hoisted items,
filtering items, expanded items, and item selection.

A single {Outline} can belong to multiple editors. For example, if the same
outline is open in two different panes, Atom creates a separate editor for
each pane. If the outline is manipulated the changes are reflected in both
editors, but each maintains its own selection, expanded items, etc.

The easiest way to get hold of `OutlineEditor` objects is by registering a
callback with `::observeOutlineEditors` through the {FoldingTextService}.

Selection.name: Selection

instanceProperties.name: anchorItem
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only {Item} where the selection is anchored.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only {Item} where the selection is anchored.

instanceProperties.name: anchorOffset
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only text offset in the anchor {Item} where the selection is anchored.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only text offset in the anchor {Item} where the selection is anchored.

instanceProperties.name: focusItem
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only {Item} where the selection is focused.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only {Item} where the selection is focused.

instanceProperties.name: focusOffset
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only text offset in the focus {Item} where the selection is focused.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only text offset in the focus {Item} where the selection is focused.

instanceProperties.name: startItem
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only first selected {Item} in outline order.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only first selected {Item} in outline order.

instanceProperties.name: startOffset
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only text offset in the start {Item} where selection starts.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only text offset in the start {Item} where selection starts.

instanceProperties.name: endItem
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only last selected {Item} in outline order.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only last selected {Item} in outline order.

instanceProperties.name: endOffset
instanceProperties.summary: Read-only text offset in the end {Item} where selection end.
instanceProperties.description: Read-only text offset in the end {Item} where selection end.

instanceProperties.name: itemsCommonAncestors
instanceProperties.summary: Read only {Array} of common ancestors of selected {Item}s.
instanceProperties.description: Read only {Array} of common ancestors of selected {Item}s.

instanceProperties.name: isCollapsed
instanceProperties.summary:
Read-only indicating whether the selection's start and end points
are at the same position.
instanceProperties.description:
Read-only indicating whether the selection's start and end points
are at the same position.

Selection.description:
The selection returned by {OutlineEditor::selection}.

The anchor of a selection is the beginning point of the selection. When
making a selection with a mouse, the anchor is where in the document the
mouse button is initially pressed. As the user changes the selection using
the mouse or the keyboard, the anchor does not move.

The focus of a selection is the end point of the selection. When making a
selection with a mouse, the focus is where in the document the mouse button
is released. As the user changes the selection using the mouse or the
keyboard, the focus is the end of the selection that moves.

The start of a selection is the boundary closest to the beginning of the
document. The end of a selection is the boundary closest to the end of the
document.

FoldingTextService.name: FoldingTextService

instanceMethods.name: getOutlineEditors
instanceMethods.summary: Get all outline editors in the workspace.
instanceMethods.description: Get all outline editors in the workspace.

returnValues.description: Returns an {Array} of {OutlineEditor}s.

instanceMethods.summary: Get the active item if it is an {OutlineEditor}.
instanceMethods.description: Get the active item if it is an {OutlineEditor}.

returnValues.description:
Returns an {OutlineEditor} or `` if the current active item is
not an {OutlineEditor}.

instanceMethods.summary: Get all outline editors for a given outine the workspace.

workspace.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: observeOutlineEditors
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback with all current and future outline
editors in the workspace.

editors in the workspace.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

FoldingTextService.summary:
This is the Atom [services
API](https://atom.io/docs/latest/creating-a-package#interacting-with-other-
packages-via-services) object vended for `ft-foldingtext-service`.
Please see the [Customizing FoldingText](README#customizing-ft) to get started
in creating a package that uses this service.
FoldingTextService.description:
This is the Atom [services
API](https://atom.io/docs/latest/creating-a-package#interacting-with-other-
packages-via-services) object vended for `ft-foldingtext-service`.
Please see the [Customizing FoldingText](README#customizing-ft) to get started
in creating a package that uses this service.
